intro: Cleomella goodrichii, commonly known as the Goodrich's cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cleomaceae, which includes several species of flowering plants commonly found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, yellow or white flowers. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a rough or hairy texture. Cleomella goodrichii is adapted to dry environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
